keyword: calories in a chick fil a fruit cup
title: Calories in a Chick-fil-A Fruit Cup
meta_description: Discover calories in a Chick-fil-A fruit cup, including carbs, sugars, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown for this fresh fruit side.
h1: Calories in a Chick-fil-A Fruit Cup
assumptions: Standard small Chick-fil-A fruit cup (~113 g) with fresh fruits like apples, strawberries, blueberries, and mandarin oranges; no added sugars or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, seasonal fruits, portion size, and preparation. Check Chick-fil-A menu or app for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A Chick-fil-A fruit cup has about 60 calories and 14 g carbs from natural fruit sources.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant info.

faqs.q: How many calories in a Chick-fil-A fruit cup?
faqs.a: About 60 calories for the standard small size.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a Chick-fil-A fruit cup?
faqs.a: Approximately 14 g carbs, including 2 g fiber and 10 g natural sugars.

faqs.q: Is the Chick-fil-A fruit cup low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 0 g total fat and no saturated or trans fats.

faqs.q: Does a Chick-fil-A fruit cup have protein?
faqs.a: Only about 1 g protein, mainly from the fruits.

faqs.q: How does fruit cup size affect calories?
faqs.a: Small is 60 kcal; medium adds ~40 kcal, large even moreâ€”check menu for details.
